source_sentence: 又復歸依如是十方盡虗空界一切三寶無量賢聖(一拜)。
translation: "Again, I take refuge in thus all three treasures of measureless worthies and sages in the whole wide world (one prostration).
Today, we're all here at the site of enlightenment.
The vows they've made are the same as those in the ten directions.
'They're all the same as those in the ten directions.
It extends to the whole spatial realm.

source_sentence: 一切諸佛大菩薩眾所有誓願。
translation: The vows made by all the buddhas and great bodhisattvas are boundless.
They can't be exhausted.
My present vow is likewise.
'It's likewise.'
It's as vast as the nature of the Dharma and as complete as space.
It's perfectly like space.
It goes on for as long as the future holds.
It will last for all eons.
...sentient beings cannot be exhausted.
Our vows cannot be exhausted.
The world can't be exhausted ...
My vow is inexhaustible.
Space is inexhaustible ...
My vows are inexhaustible ...
Dharma nature is inexhaustible ...
My vow is inexhaustible ...
Nirvāṇa is inexhaustible ...
My vow is inexhaustible ...
The Buddha's appearance in the world is inexhaustible ...
My vow is inexhaustible.
The buddhas' knowledge and wisdom are inexhaustible.
My vow is inexhaustible.
The mind's conditions are inexhaustible ...
My vows are inexhaustible.
The knowledge that arises cannot be exhausted ...
My vows are inexhaustible.

source_sentence: 世間道種法道種智慧道種不可盡。
translation: The seeds of worldly paths, the seeds of Dharma paths, and the seeds of wisdom paths cannot be exhausted.
My vow is inexhaustible.
If the ten kinds can be exhausted ...
then my vow can be exhausted.
... until the world of space comes to an end.
sentient beings and the afflictions of karma will end.
When all of these things are inexhaustible.
my vow will ultimately and permanently become inexhaustible.'
After he gives rise to this great vow.
He matched his determination with his aspiration.
Throwing their five bodies to the ground, they said.
They reverted to the world's greatly compassionate father.
Homage to Śākyamuni Buddha, the lord of the teachings.

source_sentence: 又復歸依如是十方盡虗空界一切三寶無量賢聖(一拜)。
translation: "Again, I take refuge in thus all three treasures of measureless worthies and sages in the whole wide world (one prostration).
Today, we're all here at the site of enlightenment.
May all renounce the evil destinies.
They'll always be born in the pure land.
There's no limit to the amount of almsgiving that I can give as alms.
Dharma generosity knows no limit.
merit knows no limit ...
Their well-being knows no limit ...
Their life span is inexhaustible ...
Wisdom has no limit ...
The four immeasurable states of mind ...
The six perfections ...
They can always be manifested.
The four unhindered abilities are unimpeded.
The six powers of supernormal cognition ...
As intended, they're completely at ease.
They can always see the Buddha and hear the profound Dharma.
He practices the bodhisattva path.
He vigorously undertakes vigorous effort.
Without resting or stopping, he doesn't stop.
It's until he trains.
He'll then achieve the buddha path.
He'll be able to extensively liberate all sentient beings.
